title: The 10 NBA teams that have the most to trade for Giannis
content: If the Bucks open trade talks for Giannis Antetokounmpo, which teams have the players, draft picks and contracts to get a deal done?

title: Shedeur to replace Maye in Pro Bowl, source says
content: Browns quarterback Shedeur Sanders is being added to the Pro Bowl Games roster, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Source: Rivers withdraws name from Bills search
content: Former NFL quarterback Philip Rivers has withdrawn from the Bills' coaching search, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Arizona still No.1, Nebraska No. 5 in men's poll
content: Arizona remains No. 1 in the AP Top 25 men's basketball poll, while fellow unbeaten Nebraska hit a program-best No. 5.

title: Source: Giants ink Bader to 2-year, $20.5M deal
content: The San Francisco Giants have agreed to a two-year deal with free agent center fielder Harrison Bader, a source told ESPN on Monday. The deal is worth $20.5 million, a source told ESPN's Jeff Passan.

title: Source: Udinski eyes Bills HC job, has Jags deal
content: Jaguars OC Grant Udinski has withdrawn from consideration for the Browns' head coaching position but is still pursuing the Bills' job, a source told ESPN.

title: No return of the Mac: McClung sits dunk contest
content: Three-time defending NBA Slam Dunk Contest champion Mac McClung will not defend his title, electing not to participate in the 2026 All-Star showcase.

title: Bucks don't offer timetable for Giannis return
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo's potential return date remains uncertain as the Bucks forward recovers from a calf strain.

title: Source: Chargers, Tart reach 3-year extension
content: The Chargers and defensive tackle Teair Tart agreed to a three-year extension worth up to $37.5 million with $20 million guaranteed, a source told ESPN.

title: Barnwell: What went right for the Seahawks, Patriots -- and wrong for the Rams, Broncos -- on Sunday
content: The Seahawks and Patriots both won one-score conference title games -- but in very different fashions. What did we learn about the Super Bowl-bound teams?

title: First look at Seahawks-Patriots: Early Super Bowl picks, big questions, key matchups
content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

title: Inside Sean Payton's fourth-down Patriots-Broncos call
content: Behind the scenes with Denver Broncos coach Sean Payton, before and after his failed fourth-down decision.

title: One year later for JJ Redick, the Lakers and Los Angeles
content: A year after fires burned across Los Angeles, Redick has become a public face of the rebuild and seen firsthand the generosity of those around him.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona unanimous No. 1, Nebraska at historic No. 5
content: The latest Top 25 poll is out, continuing to feature all three unbeaten teams. What's next for the ranked teams?

title: Is defeating Madison Keys the breakthrough Jessica Pegula needed?
content: Pegula dismantled the defending champ's game and looked like a player ready to win a Grand Slam title.

title: Offensive battle leads to a Seahawks win, a berth to Super Bowl LX
content: Seattle defeats Los Angeles in the NFC Championship Game and advances to Super Bowl LX to face the Patriots.

title: My first bet for Super Bowl LX: Back Seattle's offense in a high-scoring matchup
content: It's time for the biggest sports betting event of the year. Here's your first betting guide to Super Bowl LX.

title: Super Bowl LX: Odds, trends, past winners and MVPs
content: Odds and trends for Super Bowl LX, plus the updated spread, line, total and FPI projection for the big game.

title: Get ready for the Senior Bowl: Six predictions and 15 NFL draft prospects to watch in Mobile
content: Our NFL draft experts weigh in on what to expect at the Senior Bowl, from picking out position groups to watch to predicting players who could rise.

title: Lessons from Man United's victory at Arsenal; Real Madrid win ugly; Liverpool woe; more
content: Man United look better post-Ruben Amorim. Can they keep it going? And how quickly can Arsenal move past Sunday's loss? Plus: Real Madrid win ugly and Liverpool continue to suffer, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Does anyone want to win the Premier League?
content: A Man United title triumph is unlikely scenario, but a  12-point gap is nothing in this crazy season.

title: 'Uptown Funk,' 'Creed' and more trends from Seahawks' last Super Bowl berth
content: Seattle Seahawks is headed to the big game for the first time since 2015. Here are the that year's biggest trends.

title: UFC 324 grades: First fight card of the year sets a high bar
content: Five early finishes at UFC 324 were topped by a stellar title fight between Justin Gaethje and Paddy Pimblett.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold
content: Real Madrid's Trent Alexander-Arnold is being targeted for a return to the Premier League with Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Indian Embassy In Yemen Celebrates Republic Day For 1st Time In 10 Years
content: The Indian Embassy in Yemen celebrated the 77th Republic Day with great fervour. This was the embassy's first celebration in more than 10 years.

title: Parents Of Gangster Goldy Brar Arrested From Punjab In Extortion Case: Cops
content: The parents of foreign-based gangster Goldy Brar have been arrested in a 2024 extortion case in Punjab's Muktsar district on Monday, a senior police official said.

title: Case Filed Against Delhi 5-Star Hotel After Woman Alleges Food Poisoning
content: Delhi Police registered an FIR on Monday against a five-star luxury hotel, located at New Delhi's Barakhamba Road, after a woman alleged that she fell ill after consuming food there.

title: "I've Come Home": British-Indian Ex-MP Defects To Anti-Immigration Reform UK
content: Suella Braverman, former UK home secretary in the previous Conservative Party led government, on Monday defected to the anti-immigration Reform UK saying she is "calling time" on the Tories for letting immigration get "out of control".

title: Trump To Send 'Border Czar' To Minneapolis After Killing Sparks Backlash
content: US President Donald Trump announced Monday he is sending a top official to Minnesota as outrage grew over his administration's militarized immigration raids and the shooting dead of a second protester in Minneapolis.

title: 'Trump Doesn't Want People Hurt Or Killed': White House On Minnesota Killing
content: The White House said Monday that President Donald Trump did not want to see anyone hurt on US streets but quickly again blamed Democrats after anti-immigrant agents killed two people in Minneapolis.

title: Man Killed After Being Deliberately Run Over By Techie's Car In Bengaluru
content: A man was killed after allegedly being deliberately run over by a car following a drunken brawl after a cricket tournament here, police said on Monday

title: 5-Year-Old Dies In Hyderabad After Chinese Manja Slits Her Throat
content: Banned Chinese manja claimed another life in Telangana, with a five-year-old girl becoming the latest victim in Hyderabad on Monday.

title: Banks To Be Hit By Nationwide Strike On Tuesday: What To Know
content: Banking operations at public sector banks across the country are likely to be disrupted on Tuesday as the United Forum of Bank Unions (UFBU) goes ahead with its nationwide strike demanding a five-day work week.

title: Jaisalmer Man Detained For Allegedly Spying For Pakistan
content: Security agencies have detained a man from the border district of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan on suspicion of spying for Pakistan's intelligence agency ISI, officials said on Monday.

title: 200 More Stray Dogs Killed In Telangana Village
content: In yet another incident of alleged stray dogs killing in Telangana, about 200 canines were killed in Hanamkonda district, taking the toll to 1,100 in the state since December 2025, animal rights activists claimed.

title: Excise Officer Collapses, Dies Of Hear Attack During Republic Day Photo-Op
content: An excise sub inspector died of a heart attack at a Republic Day event in Maharashtra's Dharashiv district on Monday, an official said.

title: Actor, Ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty Files Complaint Over "Harassment" At Event
content: Bengali actor and former Trinamool Congress MP Mimi Chakraborty on Monday filed a police complaint against the organisers of a cultural programme, alleging public harassment during an event at Bongaon in North 24 Parganas district on Sunday night.

title: "He Said Train Was Delayed": JEE Aspirant Found Dead On Kota Railway Tracks
content: A coaching student preparing for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) was found dead in Rajasthan's Kota.

title: Nearly Half Of World's Population Could Suffer Extreme Heat By 2050, Oxford Study Warns
content: Nearly half of the world's population could be living under conditions of extreme heat by the middle of this century if current fossil fuel use continues, according to new research from the University of Oxford.

title: 'Choose Between Illegal Immigration And Protecting Identity': Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday said voters must decide in the coming assembly elections whether they want a government that "surrenders" before illegal immigrants or one that protects the state's identity and culture.

title: 'Keep Dreaming If You Feel Europe Can Defend Itself Without US': NATO Chief
content: NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte insisted on Monday that Europe is incapable of defending itself without U.S. military support and would have to more than double current military spending targets to be able to do so.

title: Congress, BJP Spar Over Alleged Robbery Of Rs 400 Crore In Demonetised Notes
content: The ruling Congress and the opposition BJP in Karnataka on Monday sparred over the alleged robbery of Rs 400 crore in demonetised Rs 2,000 currency notes at Karnataka and Maharashtra border.

title: US Deploys Aircraft Carrier In Middle Eastern Waters Amid Tensions With Iran
content: A US naval strike group led by an aircraft carrier has deployed to Middle Eastern waters, the United States said Monday, as Tehran warned it was ready to hit back at any American attack launched in response to a crackdown on anti-government protests.

title: "Aircraft Upside Down": 7 Dead After Jet Crashes In Snowstorm In US' Maine
content: The Federal Aviation Administration says seven people were killed and a crew member survived with serious injuries when a private business jet crashed in a snowstorm at Maine's Bangor International Airport.

title: Rahul ‘insulted’ northeast by not wearing Gamosa at reception hosted by President: BJP
content: Congress counters the charge by pointing out that Defence Minister Rajnath Singh had also not worn the ‘patka’

title: Banking operations to be hit on January 27 as unions to go on strike seeking five-day work week
content: With banks remaining closed on January 25 and January 26 (Republic Day), the strike on January 27 will result in a disruption of branch-level services for three consecutive days

title: Kalaburagi Next Foundation launched to drive district’s holistic development
content: Rural Development and Panchayat Raj, IT-BT Minister and Kalaburagi district in-charge Priyank Kharge on Monday launched the Kalaburagi Next Foundation, a government-supported public charitable trust aimed at promoting inclusive and sustainable development of the district through public participation and corporate collaboration.

title: Uproar intensifies against new UGC equity regulations
content: Writ petition filed in Supreme Court challenging 2026 UGC regulations; students’ union in Kumaun University submits letter opposing it

title: Census 2027 | Caste methodology yet to be decided, clarity likely by July
content: Opposition parties such as the Congress and Samajwadi Party had questioned BJP-led Union government over absence of expanded caste column in the questionnaire of the first phase of Census published last week; however, officials say caste will be enumerated only in the second and final phase

title: ‘Failed’ NDA was restored out of compulsion and blackmail, says  Tamil Nadu CM Stalin
content:
This is merely a cosmetic attempt to give the alliance a fresh build-up. Parties have joined the NDA owing to pressure
from Central government agencies, he says at ‘Vellum Tamizh Pengal’ delta zone-level DMK women’s wing conference

title: Raut slams Padma Bhushan honour for Koshyari, accuses him of toppling Uddhav govt.
content: The Rajya Sabha MP says even the Supreme Court had said Koshyari acted illegally during his tenure as Governor

title: PM Modi thanks leaders of France, Bhutan, Cyprus for Republic Day greetings
content: “Thank you my dear friend President Emmanuel Macron for your warm wishes on India’s 77th Republic Day. I look forward to welcoming you in India soon and further deepening and diversifying the India-France strategic partnership,” Mr. Modi said in response to French President Emmanuel Macron’s wishes

title: India displays military might, cultural pride at Kartavya Path
content: President leads ceremony marked by gaiety and patriotic fervour; Ashoka Chakra conferred on Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla; armed forces showcase weapon systems used during Operation Sindoor; IAF flypast features Rafales, Sukhois, MiGs

title: R-Day flower show at Lalbagh records over 8 lakh visitors, generates ₹2.75 crore
content: Last year’s Republic Day flower show at Lalbagh, themed on Adikavi Maharshi Valmiki, had recorded a total footfall of 4.75 lakh visitors

title: Seven feared dead, several missing in massive Kolkata warehouse fire
content: More than 20 people feared trapped inside the warehouse gutted in the fire; no official confirmation of casualties issued by the administration till late Monday, January 26, evening

title: Public urged to work together for development of NTR district
content: A plan is being implemented to achieve an annual growth rate of 18.5% across all sectors in the district, says Lakshmisha during the Republic Day celebrations at IGMC Stadium

title: Indians abroad celebrate Republic Day; greetings pour in from world leaders
content: Extending his wishes, U.S. President Trump says 'U.S.-India share historic bond'; Chinese President Xi says India-China relations continue to improve and develop, aligning with the fundamental interests of both countries and their people

title: Vande Mataram tableaux at the Republic Day parade
content: The notes of the national song rang clear as the Culture Ministry’s tableau, themed around ‘Vande Mataram: Swatantrata ka Mantra (freedom chant)’, rolled out on Kartavya Path

title: Constitution is protective shield for citizen rights, says Rahul Gandhi on 77th Republic Day
content: Congress leaders criticise the government for not offering front row seats to the Leaders of Opposition in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha during the Republic Day parade

title: Long march to Mumbai: Protesters march towards Mumbai, refuse to stop without meeting CM
content: Delegation to meet Ministers and officials in Mumbai on January 27; at the heart of the protest is the high rate of rejections of land ownership claims under the Forest Rights Act, and other issues pertaining to its implementation

title: Republic Day 2026: How was the Constitution amended in PM Modi’s second term
content: Constitutional amendments granting higher representation to SC,ST, OBC and women passed Parliament since 2019

title: Republic Day 2026: How was the Constitution amended in PM Modi’s first term
content: Judicial, tax, foreign reforms took centre stage in Modi’s first term, before reservation caught up by in 2019

title: BMRCL begins beautification drive under Pink Line on Bannerghatta Road
content: BMRCL has confirmed that the much-anticipated Pink Line corridor will be opened in phases by September 2026. The 7.5-km elevated section from Tavarekere to Kalena Agrahara, running along Bannerghatta Road, is expected to be commissioned by March 2026

title: Canadian PM Mark Carney likely to visit India in early March, India’s envoy to Canada says
content: Formal negotiations for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement with India should also start in March, India’s ​High Commissioner to Canada Dinesh Patnaik says

title: All set for annual celestial wedding at Antarvedi temple in Konaseema
content: The devotees will take part in the procession of the chariot on January 29 and take holy dip the next day in the confluence point of Godavari into sea at Antarvedi

title: EU-India FTA talks conclude, summit on January 27
content: A “balanced, forward-looking deal” negotiated, says govt.; EU chief Ursula von der Leyen says India and Europe will work to “shape new global order”

title: Naidu pushes for technology-driven governance, names 2026 decision-making year
content: Chief Minister stresses use of AI and digital tools to reduce field staff workload, speed up grievance redressal and improve service delivery across departments

title: Godavari Delta to be surveyed at cost of over ₹13 crore
content: Eight pacts signed to attract ₹58,850 crore investments in Kakinada district during CII-Visakhapatnam summit-2025; A fleet of 50 EV buses to be deployed in East Godavari by 2026 end

title: Nori Dattatreyudu expresses delight after Padma Bhushan honour
content: This recognition from my own country, my people, and my government holds special significance, says the noted radiation oncologist

title: Eluru Collector calls for dedicated efforts for district’s development on R-Day
content: She highlights the government’s achievements, including financial assistance to over 1.6 lakh farmers, distribution of mechanised farming equipment, procurement of Kharif crops, among others

title: Congress tries out year-round grassroots mobilisation model in Jharkhand
content: AICC in-charge K. Raju has drawn up a year-long calendar of activities involving party workers and leaders across nearly 4,350 gram panchayats in the State

title: AP Transco aims to complete 55 transmission projects this year: Joint MD
content: Projects worth ₹9,320 crore to add 8,853 MVA capacity and 1,558 circuit km lines to strengthen State power grid, he says

title: Kashmiri will survive in grief, sorrow and lament: Padma Shri nominee Shauq
content: Shafi Shauq described the Padma Shri award, among the highest civilian honours in India, as “an acknowledgement of the richness of Kashmiri language”

title: Mayawati reiterates demand of Bharat Ratna for BSP founder Kanshi Ram
content: On Republic Day, Bahujan Samaj Party leader calls for an ‘honest assessment’ of whether Central and State governments have made ‘much-needed improvement in the standard of living of the people’

title: Eluru Collector honours Information department staff for exemplary services
content: According to district administration, their consistent dedication and professional excellence earned them accolades

title: Andhra Pradesh Speaker proposes Right to Recall, no work no pay for MLAs
content: Speaking at the 77th Republic Day celebrations at the State Assembly,  Ayyanna Patrudu calls for a minimum of 60 sitting days a year to restore the dignity of legislatures, while Legislative Council Chairman Koyye Moshenu Raju hails the Constitution as the greatest guiding text

title: State likely to set up committee for Gig Workers’ Welfare Board today
content: The board will have 15 members, with representation from the government, gig workers, aggregator bodies and civil society

title: Suspected militants torch houses, farmhouses in Manipur’s Kangpokpi district
content: The Zeliangrong United Front (ZUF) has claimed responsibility for the act and alleged that the houses and farmhouses were being used by illicit poppy cultivators

title: A.P. Food Safety department tightens focus on sale of cotton candy
content: Despite containing harmful colouring agent Rhodamine B, the use of which is prohibited in the State, the sale of cotton candy continues in public gatherings in Vijayawada, including the recent Vijayawada Book Festival

title: Despite ICE raids & crackdowns, Indians flood US borders; one caught every 20 mins in 2025
content: Despite an aggressive US crackdown, one Indian was apprehended at the border every 20 minutes in 2025. While numbers dropped from 2024, the allure of the American dream persists, with single adults seeking work and a troubling rise in unaccompanied children. Smugglers are shifting to riskier routes as enforcement intensifies.

title: 'They don't want to give visa': One-year-long waiting list for H-1B interviews
content: Indian professionals face significant H-1B visa disruptions as new stamping dates are unavailable this year, with interviews deferred to 2027. US consulates in India report no regular slots, and experts see no immediate improvement. Stricter US visa policies, including social media screening and a ban on third-country stamping, are contributing to the severe delays and visa revocations.

title: US snow storm: At least 25 dead as severe winter weather sweeps across regions
content: A massive winter storm has claimed at least 25 lives across the United States, bringing heavy snow to the Northeast and widespread power outages in the South. Freezing rain and snow caused significant travel disruptions, with thousands of flights cancelled and schools closed.  The storm's impact included deadly accidents and exposure-related deaths, leaving hundreds of thousands without electricity.

title: Microsoft and Amazon take out full-page ad, warn Washington faces ‘emergency’
content: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have joined forces to tackle Washington State's severe housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an op-ed, pledging $1.6 billion to build over 26,000 affordable homes for the community. They urge policymakers to prioritize policies that simplify and expedite construction, warning that inaction risks further economic decline and talent loss.

title: Oracle cofounder Larry Ellison on the biggest problem that all AI models
content: Oracle's Larry Ellison believes the AI race is becoming a commodity due to shared internet data. He argues the future lies in leveraging private enterprise data, a move Oracle is heavily investing in with massive infrastructure plans.  While competitors are also building enterprise AI, Oracle's existing database dominance could be key to its success in this next AI wave.

title: In Republic Day messages, Trump hails historic bond, Xi talks of dragon-elephant tango
content: Global leaders, including US President Trump and China's Xi Jinping, extended Republic Day greetings to India. Trump emphasized the bond between the world's oldest and largest democracies, while Xi highlighted India-China as "good neighbours, friends and partners." King Charles III also lauded the enduring India-UK partnership, noting shared values and deepening cooperation.

title: Minnesota governor, Donald Trump have ‘productive’ call over ICE protests
content: Following the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by a Border Patrol agent, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and President Trump held a "productive" call. Trump agreed to allow the Minnesota Bureau of Criminal Apprehension to investigate the incident and to review reducing federal agent numbers in the state.

title: Microsoft tells engineers to use Claude Code and GitHub Copilot, report which works better
content: Microsoft is having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in Anthropic's AI coding tools, even as Copilot remains its flagship enterprise product. The company is encouraging experimentation across various teams, reflecting a pragmatic approach to leveraging multiple AI tools for optimal software development.

title: Indian-origin British civil servant gets flak for UK giving Chagos to Mauritius
content: A British civil servant of Indian origin, Dr. Francis Vijay Narasimhan Rangarajan, faces social media backlash over the controversial Chagos deal. He led negotiations to transfer sovereignty of the Chagos Archipelago to Mauritius, retaining use of the Diego Garcia base. Critics, including former politicians, have voiced strong opposition to the agreement.

title: India, EU finalise FTA, deal set to be announced today
content: India and the European Union have finalized a comprehensive free trade agreement after 18 years of talks, poised to boost trade and investment. The deal, expected to be announced Tuesday, aims for significant tariff reductions on most goods, with India gaining market access for textiles and leather, while offering concessions on automobiles and wines. Implementation is anticipated by early 2027.

title: ‘Insensitive and insulting’: BJP says Rahul Gandhi declined to wear Assamese Gamosa; Congress counters
content: The BJP has criticized Rahul Gandhi for allegedly not wearing an Assamese 'Gamosa' at a Republic Day reception, with Assam's CM demanding an apology. Congress countered by questioning why Defence Minister Rajnath Singh wasn't also asked to wear it, accusing the BJP of trivial politics and highlighting alleged disrespect towards their leaders at the parade.

title: Microsoft rolls out Maia 200 AI chips; launch note has 'message' for Google, Amazon
content: Microsoft has launched its Maia 200 AI chip, aiming to rival Nvidia, Amazon, and Google. This new chip, built on TSMC's advanced 3nm process, promises significant performance and cost efficiencies for AI workloads.  Microsoft's own superintelligence team will be among the first to utilize the Maia 200, powering services like Copilot and OpenAI models on Azure.

title: Kashmir peaceful, ready to welcome visitors, says deputy CM
content: Jammu and Kashmir Deputy Chief Minister Surinder Choudhary stated that Pakistan's efforts to disrupt tourism in the region have failed. He urged people to visit Kashmir, emphasizing its peaceful atmosphere and readiness to welcome visitors, while also honoring the victims of a past terror attack.

title: 1,059 days on, WPL gets its first hundred — Nat Sciver-Brunt makes it
content: Nat Sciver-Brunt etched her name in WPL history, smashing the tournament's inaugural century with an unbeaten 100 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. This remarkable feat propelled her to the top of the season's run charts and solidified her status as a dominant force in women's cricket. Her stellar performance anchored Mumbai Indians' innings, setting a formidable target.

title: Travis Kelce romance sparks debate over Taylor Swift’s songwriting
content: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: Cooper Kupp’s wife draws reaction in Seahawks coat
content: Cooper Kupp’s NFC Championship appearance against his former Rams blended football and family into one powerful moment. Now with the Seahawks, the Super Bowl MVP faced his past while drawing strength from his wife Anna and their three sons. The matchup symbolized resilience, loyalty, and a fresh chapter driven by purpose.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers explore roster upgrade via Kings trio
content: NBA trade deadline buzz sees Lakers eyeing a deal with the Kings. The proposed trade, involving Malik Monk, Keon Ellis, and Devin Carter going to LA for Dalton Knecht, Gabe Vincent, and Maxi Kleber, aims to bolster the Lakers' inconsistent bench scoring and defense. Sacramento would gain valuable assets and flexibility.

title: 76ers vs Hornets injury report: Who’s in and out
content: The Philadelphia 76ers face the Charlotte Hornets on January 26, with the Hornets favored despite a worse record. Philadelphia is managing a back-to-back and resting key players, notably Joel Embiid and Paul George, due to knee injury management. Charlotte, while also dealing with injuries, expects its primary scorers to be available at home.

title: T20 WC row: PCB considers boycotting India match in support of Bangladesh
content: Pakistan's T20 World Cup participation hangs in the balance, with a decision on playing against co-hosts India delayed until at least Friday. Discussions are underway regarding a potential boycott in solidarity with Bangladesh, who were removed from the tournament. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has directed the cricket board to explore all options.

title: Quote of the day by Will Smith: ‘To place the responsibility for your happiness... '
content: Will Smith, the Hollywood powerhouse known for his incredible range in both film and music, also serves as a beacon of inspiration. In his enlightening memoir, 'Will,' co-created with Mark Manson, he shares a striking insight: our happiness is our own responsibility.

title: Abhishek Sharma's Record T20I Fifty: Unique routine goes viral after 14-ball blitz
content: Abhishek Sharma's pre-batting ritual is back in the spotlight after his record-shattering 14-ball T20I half-century against New Zealand.  His explosive 68 off 20 balls, featuring seven fours and five sixes, propelled India to a series-clinching victory.  Sharma now holds the record for most T20I fifties in under 25 balls, solidifying his top ranking.

title: 'Taking gomutra to world': Cong's snide remark on Padma Shri awardee sparks row
content: A political row erupted on social media after the Congress questioned IIT Madras director V Kamakoti's Padma Shri award, linking it to research on cow dung and urine. Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu strongly defended Kamakoti, highlighting his deep tech expertise and the scientific potential of traditional substances, criticizing a "slavish colonial mindset."

title: Booed, abused, but still here: Hardik Pandya's decade in Indian cricket
content: Hardik Pandya's decade in Indian cricket has been a journey of impact and resilience, marked by explosive starts, physical setbacks, and leadership roles. From a costly debut over to crucial World Cup final performances, his career showcases volatility, scrutiny, and a consistent ability to influence games with both bat and ball.

title: Orry takes another dig at Sara Ali Khan, netizens call it 'pathetic'
content: Influencer Orry has publicly targeted actress Sara Ali Khan and her mother, Amrita Singh, with recent social media jabs. After a veiled dig in an Instagram Reel, Orry directly mocked Sara's career, sparking widespread criticism online for his "vile" and "pathetic" behavior.

title: 'Rajasthan's biggest explosives haul': How a tip-off led to seizure of 10,000 kg ammonium nitrate
content: Nagaur police seized nearly 10,000 kg of ammonium nitrate and other explosives, arresting one man in what officials called the state's biggest such haul. The operation, conducted just before Republic Day, uncovered a significant quantity of blasting material at a farmhouse. Authorities are investigating the source and intended use of the seized explosives.

title: ‘No more hostages in Gaza’: IDF recovers last captive held by Hamas; remains repatriated to Israel
content: The Israeli military has recovered the remains of Ran Gvili, the last hostage held in Gaza, confirming all abductees have been returned to Israel. Prime Minister Netanyahu hailed this as an extraordinary achievement, fulfilling a promise to bring everyone back. Hamas stated the discovery confirms their commitment to the ceasefire agreement.

title: Hypersonic missiles, phased battle array & Op Sindoor: India flexes might on 77th R-Day parade
content: India celebrates its 77th Republic Day on Monday, with nationwide events marking the adoption of the Constitution and highlighting the country’s cultural and military heritage. Celebrations of the 77th Republic Day at the Kartvya Path were based on the theme of the 150th Anniversary of the national song, Vande Mataram, a timeless mantra that awakened the spirit of Swadeshi, self-reliance, and freedom in India's national consciousness.

title: India's air superiority during Op Sindoor made Pak call for truce: European military analysis
content: A European military analysis reveals India achieved air superiority during Operation Sindoor. This 88-hour operation in May 2025 forced Pakistan to seek a ceasefire. The report highlights the effectiveness of India's integrated air defence system. It also notes the loss of an Indian Rafale fighter jet. The conflict involved advanced aircraft and sophisticated air defence networks.

title: Jason Robertson emerges as Rangers’ top trade target as New York looks to replace Artemi Panarin
content: New York Rangers are eyeing Dallas Stars forward Jason Robertson as a key piece for their future. General Manager Chris Drury seeks young, skilled, and speedy players, and Robertson fits the bill perfectly. With Artemi Panarin reportedly leaving, Robertson's elite offensive talent and age make him an ideal replacement to build around for years to come.

title: Varun Dhawan gets slammed for performing stunts inside Mumbai Metro
content: Actor Varun Dhawan faced criticism from Maha Mumbai Metro authorities after a video surfaced showing him doing pull-ups on overhead grab handles during his commute. The metro operator warned that such actions are punishable under the Metro Railways Act, 2002, potentially leading to penalties or imprisonment.

title: ‘Insult to Maharashtra’: Oppn slams Padma Bhushan for Koshiyari; ex-governor shrugs off criticism
content: Opposition leaders slammed the Centre's decision to award Padma Bhushan to former Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshiyari, citing his alleged role in toppling the MVA government and insulting state icons. However, CM Devendra Fadnavis defended the award, highlighting Koshiyari's societal contributions and work for development.

title: As US-Canada ties worsen, Carney eyes reset with India; visit likely in March
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is slated to visit India in early March to sign significant deals on uranium, energy, minerals, AI, education, and culture. This visit aims to diversify Canada's alliances and reset bilateral relations, with formal CEPA negotiations also set to commence. Both nations are prioritizing these agreements amid a changing global order and U.S. trade pressures.

title: Revisiting India's first Republic Day; the parade that started it all
content: India celebrated its 77th Republic Day with a grand parade on Kartavya Path, showcasing military might and cultural diversity. The event marked the EU's first military parade participation outside Europe, reflecting India's growing global ties. The celebrations honored the nation's journey since becoming a sovereign democratic republic on January 26, 1950.

title: 'Border 2' producer reveals Akshaye Khanna's cameo was not added due to 'Dhurandhar' success
content: In a recent statement, the creators of 'Border 2' emphasized that Akshaye Khanna's brief yet impactful appearance was intricately woven into the storyline from the get-go. Director Anurag Singh confirmed that the scene, filmed last December, serves as a heartfelt nod to the beloved 1997 classic, rather than a response to Khanna's newfound social media fame.

title: Manoj Bajpayee almost lost his role in 'Bandit Queen'
content: Manoj Bajpayee reminisces about his debut in Shekhar Kapoor's 1994 film 'Bandit Queen,' marking 32 years since its release. He recounts how his photograph was chosen from a lot by Kapoor and how the role of Vikram Malla, initially cast with Nirmal Pandey and later considered for Naseeruddin Shah, ultimately came back to him.

title: After a gap of over 10 years, India marks Republic Day in Yemen
content: For the first time in over a decade, India celebrated Republic Day in Yemen with the Indian community and embassy staff. Other diplomatic missions in the US, Singapore, Japan, and Sri Lanka also marked the occasion with flag unfurling ceremonies and participation from the Indian diaspora. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio extended greetings, highlighting the strong bilateral partnership.

title: India’s study-abroad corridor: Why Andhra, Punjab and only few other states go global
content: India’s study-abroad boom looks national on paper, but the pipeline is regional in practice. State-wise data shows a narrow corridor of sending states that barely changes between 2016 and 2020, even as destinations shift from the US to Canada and beyond. The pattern suggests overseas education is driven less by aspiration than by ecosystem: credit access, counselling networks, professional-degree pipelines and migration memory.

title: 'Call that India must take': Ex-cricketer questions Samson's place after golden duck
content: Aakash Chopra highlighted Ishan Kishan's strong T20I form against New Zealand, contrasting it with Sanju Samson's struggles. Kishan's consistent performances and Samson's recent dismissals raise questions about India's wicketkeeper-batter choice, especially with Tilak Varma's potential return.

title: 'Lost interest': Days after prez Al Nahyan's 3-hr Delhi visit, UAE scraps airport deal with Pak
content: Abu Dhabi has reportedly scrapped its airport management deal with Pakistan, citing a failure to find a local partner. This comes as Pakistan strengthens defense ties with Saudi Arabia, while the UAE deepens its strategic partnership with India, signing multiple agreements during President Mohamed bin Zayed's recent New Delhi visit.

title: Potential unexpected college stars from the boys' class of 2026
content: the current freshman class would be one of the most talented and impactful in decades . names such as AJ Dybantsa , darryn Peterson , Cameron Boozer , Caleb Wilson , darius Acuff Jr . and Kingston Flemings have lived up to the billing .

title: Bracketology watch guide: Duke's chance to be No. 1 overall, plus big weekend moves
content: we provide inside look at the headlines and upcoming matchups that inform Joey Brackets' calculations on any given night . this page will update every day around lunchtime, between Tuesday and Saturday to start . a team's projection on that day is 68 for the 2026 NCAA tournament .

title: UCLA's Bob Chesney: Coal miner, bartender, coach of the Bruins
content: new coach Bob Chesney has mined coal, slung Red Bull and vodkas behind a bar . he has worked every on-field job from strength coach to special teams coach . "he's the kind of guy I want to get in the foxhole with," athletic director says .

title: After Clippers' 15-3 run, fan follows through on eating his words
content: the LA Clippers defeated the Brooklyn Nets 126-89 on a 15-3 stretch dating back to December . fans remembered Flom's post on X as soon as the final buzzer sounded . he stayed true to his word, saying he would indeed eat a printout of his post .

title: The Patriots just showed us what it means to hire the right coach
content: the new England Patriots take over late in the AFC Championship game . they beat the Houston Texans 10-7 to advance to the super bowl on febr. 8 . it's not supposed to happen this fast, but teams aren't supposed to be able to miss the playoffs three seasons in a row .

title: The two sides of Mitch Marner's return home to Toronto
content: the Toronto Maple Leafs honor Mitch Marner in a tribute video . the star player spent nine seasons with the team . he left his hometown team and joined the Vegas Golden Knacks . marner's car was stolen and his address was leaked online .

title: ⚾ MLB breakout teams: Who's better in 2026?
content: a breakout team is a club that wins at least 10 more games than what would be expected by its established level of play . we'll use wins per 162 games for the previous two seasons, while giving double weight to the most recent season . last season, the highest baseline win level was the Los Angeles Dodgers .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: South Carolina slips
content: the new AP top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the results of a pair of SEC showdowns shuffled the top of the rankings . south Carolina Gamecocks dropped one spot to no. 3 .

title: 'Sirf Trivedi bachega': Inside 'Mafia don' Xi's 'Sacred Games' with PLA generals
content: Much like a Mafia don, Xi has shown that he considers even his associates to be disposable. More important, the staggering political casualties reflect that he is losing patience with his military rather than his control over it. “This move is unprecedented in the history of the Chinese military and represents the total annihilation of the high command.” Xi has reached the point where he no longer needs Zhang, who has protected him and pushed through historic reforms of the PLA, but is now perceived to be a rival and threat to Xi’s absolute grasp on power.
